page.title: 07FISHING CATCHES DOWNDERRY
page.content: LOBSTER BOATS'SHOOT' 30-190 POTS DAILY.THE BEST BOATS AVERAGE 1 LOBSTER PER 10 POTS,A LOWER RETURN THAN 30 YEARS AGO.IN 1985 EDIBLE CRAB CATCHES ARE VERY LOW AND PRICES POOR.SPIDER CRABS ARE ALSO SCARCE BUT RETURN BETTER PRICES.BROWN CRAB (=EDIBLE) AND LOBSTER ARE KEPT IN FLOATING 'STORE POTS' MOORED IN THE 'POOL' WHICH ONLY DRIES AT LOW SPRING TIDES.SPIDER CRABS DESTINED FOR THE SPANISH MARKET ARE STORED IN NET BAGS ON THE SEA BED HALF A MILE OFFSHORE.MOST OTHER FISHING IS BY HANDLINE FOR MACKEREL.MULTIPLE FEATHERED HOOKS ARE BAIT.SMALL BOATS (14'-16') POWERED BY PETROL ENGINES CAN CATCH 20 STONE ON A GOOD EVENING. SOME BOATS USE MONOFILAMENT BOTTOM NETS CATCHING A VARIETY OF FISH,eg PLAICE,POLLACK,BASS BUT MOSTLY WRASSE. SALMON AND SEA TROUT ARE SOMETIMES TRAPPED BUT THEY MUST NOT BE LANDED !
